text: Iris Shun-Ru Chang (March 28, 1968 â€“ November 9, 2004) was an American writer and journalist. She wrote several best-selling books. Her books included Thread of the Silkworm, The Rape of Nanking and The Chinese of America. She was born in Princeton, New Jersey. She was raised in Illinois. Chang spent her last years living in San Jose, California. On November 9, 2004, Chang died by suicide. ==Related pages== *List of Chinese writers Category:Journalists from Illinois Category:Journalists from New Jersey Category:Writers from New Jersey Category:Writers who committed suicide Category:1968 births Category:2004 deaths Category:People from Princeton, New Jersey Category:Writers from Illinois
title: Iris Chang
